full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/18/2023 21. (I am submitting the following personal documents in support of and as part of my application) Birth certificate) Military record) (Promise of employment) (Police certificate(s)) (Evidence of support or (Medical record(s)) (Other (describe)) resources) (Marriage certificate) fs55r 22. (Since birth my places of residence for 6 months or more have been (Give street address in Hong Kong, Macau, and other cities)) (-) (Country), (Province), (District,) (Heung,) #(Village,) (Street Address), (Dates(From-To)) (Occupation) Ping Kong Market, Toisan, Kwangtung, China. 1914-1929 Student 16, Yiu Wah Tai St., Canton, Kwangtung, China. 1929-1933 Student Chee Chi College, Shanghai, China. 1933-1935 Student Japan University, Tokyo, Japan. 1935-1937 Student Chungking, Szechwan, China. 1940 Government Officer Shui Kwan biz ) Kwangtung, China. 1941-1945 -do- Hainan, Kwangtung, China. 1945-1947 -do- 16, Yiu Wah Tai St., Canton, Kwangtung, China. 1948-1959 Businessman Out of 22, Pok Man St., 4th F1., Kowloon, Hong Kong. 1959-date employment 29. (Since my sixteenth birthday I am or have been a member or affiliate of the following political, professional, vocational or social organizations) (Name and address) (Dates (From-To)) (Type of membership and office held, if any) National Party 1940-date Member 30. Frese (I speak, read, write the following languages (Include your native languages)) (Languages) (Speak) (Read) (Write) Chinese (Mandarin) Japaness Cantoness Dialeet & Toysan dialect 31. (I have previously been in the United States during the following periods (Give year and type of visa or status) (If never, so state)) I have never been in the U.S. 32. (United States immigration laws require that all prospective immigrants answer the following questions. This requirement does not imply that you are suspected, of being within any of the classes described in these questions. Your answers will assist the consular officer to establish your eligibility to receive a visa. If you are unable to answer any of these questions please explain your inability fully on a separate sheet of paper which you should attach to this form. Please bear in mind that whatever the nature of your answers to these questions, you are not necessarily ineligible to receive a visa. For example, if you were arrested and/or convicted for a minor offense, and the consular officer is able to establish that such offense was in fact a misdemeanor, your arrest and/or conviction would not necessarily make you ineligible for a visa.) (Give the correct answer to the following questions by circling "Yes" or "No") (Have you ever been arrested for, charged Yes No (e) narcotic or other offense?) ary prison or jail?) (2) (a) pardon.
